meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of insects.
meanings.sent1: The tiny creature had an insectile appearance with its six legs and antennae.
meanings.sent2: The garden was full of insectile activity, with bees buzzing and butterflies fluttering around.
meanings.sent3: The insectile robot scurried around the room, amusing the children with its lifelike movements.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on the dance floor were insectile, graceful yet precise like a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The insectile wings of the dragonfly shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the characteristics of an insect.
meanings.sent1: The strange alien had an insectile face with multiple eyes and long antennae.
meanings.sent2: The insectile markings on the leaf made it look like a camouflage for a tiny bug.
meanings.sent3: The insectile costume at the party was a hit, making everyone look like giant beetles.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an insectile quality, buzzing softly like a cicada in the summer.
meanings.sent5: The insectile movements of the robot were so realistic that it was mistaken for a real bug.
